Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BoardState
    public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements BoardState
    Class implementing the BoardState interface The board of the game is a 6*7 matrix of integer values from 0, to 3. The number 0 means that the cell of the board is empty, the number 1 means player, while the number 2 and 3 means AI
    Author:
    Márton Ákos

      • Board

        public Board()

      • Board

        public Board​(Board old,
             int i,
             int j,
             int k)
        Constructs a board state based on another one. Only one cell is different
        Parameters:
        old - the another board state
        i - the row coordinate of the different cell
        j - the column coordinate of the differenct cell
        k - the new symbol in the different cell

      • Board

        public Board​(Board from)
        Constructs a copy of the provided board state
        Parameters:
        from - the board which gets copied

      • get

        public int get​(int i,
               int j)
        Returns the value of a cell based on provided row and column coordinates.
        Parameters:
        i - row coordinate
        j - column coordinate
        Returns:
        the value of the cell, or -1 if out of bound
